getDegree

public java.lang.Object[] getDegree(int algID,
                                    int[] vertices)
Returns an array of degrees of the given vertices in the given Degree algorithm instance. The order of the degree values in the array corresponds to the order of the given vertices.

Parameters:
algorithm - index
array - of vertices
Returns:
array of degree values

getDegree

public java.lang.Object[] getDegree(int algID)
Returns an array of degree values of all vertices in the given Degree algorithm instance. The order of the degree values in the array corresponds to the order of the vertices in the graph.

Parameters:
algorithm - index
Returns:
array of degree values

getSumGroup

public int getSumGroup(int algID,
                       java.lang.Object[] vertices,
                       java.lang.Object[] edges)
Returns the sum of degree values of the given vertices in the given Degree instance.

Parameters:
algorithm - index
array - of vertices
Returns:
degree value

getCentralVertices

public java.lang.Object[] getCentralVertices(int algID,
                                             int k,
                                             java.lang.Object[] candidatesObj,
                                             java.lang.Object[] givenVerticesObj,
                                             java.lang.Object[] givenEdgesObj)
Searches for deployment of vertices (using TopK algorithm) according to given parameters.

Parameters:
Degree - algorithm index
k - is the size of the desired deployment
vertex - candidates for the deployment (can be an empty list)
givenVertices - are the already deployed vertices (can be an empty list)
givenLinks - are the already deployed links (can be an empty list)
Returns:
array of vertices

getCentralEdges

public java.lang.Object[] getCentralEdges(int algID,
                                          int k,
                                          java.lang.Object[] candidatesObj,
                                          java.lang.Object[] givenVerticesObj,
                                          java.lang.Object[] givenEdgesObj)
Searches for deployment of edges (using TopK algorithm) according to given parameters.

Parameters:
Degree - algorithm index
k - is the size of the desired deployment
edge - candidates for the deployment (can be an empty list)
givenVertices - are the already deployed vertices (can be an empty list)
givenLinks - are the already deployed links (can be an empty list)
Returns:
array of edges In the candidates array and in the result array every two successive elements represent an edge. Namely, A[0]-A[1], A[2]-A[3], A[4]-A[5] represent 3 edges.

getCentralVerticesAsynch

public int getCentralVerticesAsynch(int algID,
                                    int k,
                                    java.lang.Object[] candidatesObj,
                                    java.lang.Object[] givenVerticesObj,
                                    java.lang.Object[] givenEdgesObj)
Starts an execution which searches for deployment of vertices (using TopK algorithm) according to given parameters.

Parameters:
Degree - algorithm index
k - is the size of the desired deployment
candidates - for the deployment (can be an empty list)
givenVertices - are the already deployed vertices (can be an empty list)
givenLinks - are the already deployed links (can be an empty list)
Returns:
execution index

getCentralEdgesAsynch

public int getCentralEdgesAsynch(int algID,
                                 int k,
                                 java.lang.Object[] candidatesObj,
                                 java.lang.Object[] givenVerticesObj,
                                 java.lang.Object[] givenEdgesObj)
Starts an execution which searches for deployment of edges (using TopK algorithm) according to given parameters.

Parameters:
Degree - algorithm index
k - is the size of the desired deployment
edge - candidates for the deployment (can be an empty list)
givenVertices - are the already deployed vertices (can be an empty list)
givenLinks - are the already deployed links (can be an empty list)
Returns:
execution index In the candidates array and in the result array every two successive elements represent an edge. Namely, A[0]-A[1], A[2]-A[3], A[4]-A[5] represent 3 edges.
